intro: Piper parvulum, commonly known as the dwarf pepper plant, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper species such as black pepper. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. Its small, white flowers are borne in clusters, and the plant produces tiny, peppery fruits that are often used in local cuisines. Due to its compact size and ornamental value, it is also cultivated as a houseplant in some regions.
